16:30.race_name: Bet £20 Get £20 With Unibet/EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Finished a well-beaten seventh over 1m here in October when easy to back at 14-1
runners.name: Cheshire Cat
runners.spotlight: Finished a well-beaten seventh over 1m here in October when easy to back at 14-1; he's well related and has been gelded, but on jockey bookings he's the stable second string here.

runners.breeder: J Hanly A Stroud And T Stewart
runners.comment: Beaten five times, the last twice following wind surgery; should still have a say
runners.name: New Bay Star
runners.spotlight: Beaten five times, the last twice following wind surgery and raced keenly in the new cheekpieces last time at Newcastle (1m2f); clearly has a big run in him nonetheless.

runners.comment: Strong form claims but his last run was a backward step when tried in cheekpieces
runners.name: Only In Manila
runners.spotlight: Ran to a similar level in his first three races, though was turned over at odds of 2-5 here before taking a backward step when tried in cheekpieces at Lingfield; has a bit to prove on the back of that and he's been kept to 1m thus far.

runners.comment: Showed plenty more when a close fourth at Newcastle and he's bred for this longer trip
runners.name: Roker Roar
runners.spotlight: Never figured on Goodwood debut but showed more at Newcastle (1m) when just over 2l off the winner and he could have finished closer; bred for this longer trip and has to be of interest.

17:00.race_name: Weekly Money Back Races At Unibet Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 40-1 and ran to a modest level on last month's Southwell debut (7f)
runners.name: Divine Wish
runners.spotlight: 40-1 and ran to a modest level on her Southwell debut last month (7f); not easily recommended.

runners.comment: Modest maiden hurdler; well held in two Flat runs (1m2f); no appeal dropped to 7f
runners.name: Everest
runners.owner: Alan Jamieson Site Services & G L Moore
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden hurdler; big prices and well beaten in two 1m2f novice runs on AW in late 2025; no appeal dropped to 7f.

runners.comment: Two runs in November both offered hope of better; each-way shout
runners.name: Breathe Easy
runners.spotlight: Two novice runs in November offered hope of better; has a bit of ground to find with The Stone Power on latest run but open to improvement

runners.comment: Improved with each of his three 6f runs; looks ready for 7f and he's a strong contender
runners.name: Leonetto
runners.spotlight: He has improved with each of his three runs, keeping on for second behind a useful rival at Southwell 18 days ago (6f); looks ready for 7f now and he is a leading candidate.

runners.comment: 95,000euros breeze-up 2yo; bred to have a future but perhaps over a bit further
runners.name: Menzies
runners.spotlight: 95,000euros breeze-up 2yo; fifth foal; closely related to 1m1f-1m4f winner Eternal Hope (including AW/US turf Grade 2; RPR 115), half-brother to French 6.5f AW 2yo winner Word's Out (86); dam 7f AW 2yo winner (79), herself a half-sister to 7f-1m2f Group 1 winner Rio De La Plata; bred to have a future but perhaps over a bit further.

runners.comment: Beaten 12l when third of five in a 6f novice here last month; marked improvement necessary
runners.name: Mohmentous
runners.spotlight: Third of five in a 6f novice here last month but he was beaten 12l and needs a big step forward over the additional furlong.

runners.comment: 2nd fav for Wolverhampton debut (7f) but dropped away to finish 5th; progress is essential
runners.name: Quick Quasar
runners.spotlight: Dropped away to be beaten over 9l on his Wolverhampton debut last month (7f; 9-2 second favourite); can do better but progress is essential.

runners.comment: Modest form this winter on first three starts (6f-1m), the latest at Southwell last night
runners.name: Rawson
runners.spotlight: Modest form this winter on his first three starts (6f-1m), the latest at Southwell last night.

runners.comment: Promise on debut and latest third came in a warm race; more to come and he is a key player
runners.name: The Stone Power
runners.spotlight: Finished just in front of Breathe Easy at Southwell on debut (7f); failed to build on it when third at Lingfield last month (1m) but the winner looks a smart prospect and the second and fourth have won since; more to come back at 7f.

runners.comment: 170,000gns yearling; dam a 7f-8.5f winner (RPR 89); already gelded; betting to guide
runners.name: Zambezi River
runners.spotlight: 58,000euros foal, 170,000gns yearling; first foal of a 7f-8.5f winner (including US AW/dirt; RPR 89); already gelded but he is bred to have a future and needs a close market check.

runners.comment: Blew the start and always behind on last month's Lingfield debut (1m); best watched
runners.name: Celestique
runners.spotlight: Blew the start and was always behind on her Lingfield debut five weeks ago (1m; 14-1); best watched on the back of that effort.

runners.comment: Half-sister to 5 winners out of a winning mare; yard's newcomers usually better for a run
runners.name: Follow My Heart
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to five winners including Adaay To Remember (Group-placed 6f; RPR 105), Morte Point (6f/7f including 2yo/AW; 97) and Study Up (6f; 82); dam 5f 2yo winner (70), half-sister to 5f Group 2 winner Stepper Point; useful pedigree but stable's newcomers usually better for a run.

runners.comment: Modest sixth in two runs this winter, including C&D; improvement required
runners.name: Stole My Heart
runners.spotlight: She finished a modest sixth in her two runs in late 2025, the latest over C&D; improvement essential.

17:30.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap

runners.comment: 2nd over C&D in October off 5lb higher; quiet since but down in class with headgear added
runners.name: Mr Cool
runners.spotlight: His second over C&D in October reads well; beaten in better races three times since but now drops in class with cheekpieces given a go; revival possible.

runners.comment: C&D winner in 2024; two runs for new yard need bettering but not impossible down in class
runners.name: Nemov
runners.spotlight: C&D winner for Clive Cox in August 2024; down the field in two runs for new connections after 418 days off but has looked to retain some ability; this race should prove a better guide as to where he is at the moment.

runners.comment: Chelmsford win this month but only midfield behind Waistcoat ten days ago
runners.name: Em Four
runners.spotlight: Three wins in 2025 and he got off the mark this year with a narrow success at Chelmsford 19 days ago; only midfield behind Waistcoat back at Chelmsford ten days ago and needs to return to his best.

runners.comment: Well beaten in two runs for new yard and only dropped 1lb; had wind op since latest
runners.name: McKenna
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 7f when trained by George Boughey; well beaten in two runs for new connections and only dropped 1lb for his troubles; has had a wind op since latest but not easily recommended.

runners.comment: On an upward path for current yard; ready Chelmsford win latest; solid despite 5lb penalty
runners.name: Waistcoat
runners.spotlight: Had excuses when well held over a mile here in October but otherwise on the up for his new stable, winning 6f handicaps at Chepstow and Chelmsford; that latest success was a decisive one and he looks a strong contender despite his 5lb penalty.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 quietly; on dangerous mark but too much to prove for comfort
runners.name: Northcliff
runners.spotlight: Thrown in on last spring's form but he ended 2025 with some modest efforts; well beaten at Wolverhampton last month after a short break and, as there, he has landed a wide stall.

runners.comment: All wins at 7f but he's fully effective at this trip; in the mix but needs a personal best
runners.name: City Cyclone
runners.spotlight: He has done all his winning at 7f but is effective at this trip, as when third of nine over C&D six weeks ago; 1lb rise asks more of him.

runners.comment: Three wins from five runs for new yard; better than latest run suggests; not ruled out
runners.name: State Of Madness
runners.spotlight: Coaxed back to form by his new stable, winning twice at Brighton in October and adding a 6f win at Newcastle to his tally last month; only fourth off this mark at Wolverhampton last time but that was possibly not conclusive evidence the handicapper has his measure.

runners.comment: Well treated on last year's best and addition of a hood looks a good move; not ruled out
runners.name: Cayman Tai
runners.spotlight: Still seeking a first handicap success but some of last year's 6f form gives him strong claims off a reduced mark; the addition of a hood could also help this freegoing sort settle better; not discounted.

runners.comment: 2-2 over C&D; returns from a break with Oisin Murphy booked; betting useful
runners.name: Iconic Times
runners.spotlight: 2-2 over C&D; only 2lb higher than for his win last summer and he returns from a break with Oisin Murphy booked; betting useful.

runners.comment: On a good mark on 2025 best but not firing on all cylinders of late; yard run two here
runners.name: Expert Agent
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; scored twice on turf last summer and now 3lb lower than when seeing off 14 rivals at Haydock in July; needs to step up a notch; yard also run Nemov.

runners.comment: Should be well treated and last month's return to action was okay but others look stronger
runners.name: Invincible Speed
runners.spotlight: 5lb lower than for last spring's Lingfield success (6f, AW) and he didn't run badly back from a break at Southwell last month; others still make more appeal.

18:00.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap (London Stayers' Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Ideally positioned when winning last time but still a likely contender off 2lb higher
runners.name: Appier
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner; only fourth run for this yard when winning at Wolverhampton (2m); was ideally positioned given how that panned out but a likely contender off 2lb higher.

runners.comment: Last run too bad to be true and he always commands respect at this track
runners.name: Zoran
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at Southwell last time which was too bad to be true as does have form there; he's won twice here and ran well over C&D in December behind one who scored impressively last week; considered under Oisin Murphy.

runners.breeder: Lynn Lodge Stud & Pier House Stud
runners.comment: He's not won for a long time and finishing effort can be questionable
runners.name: Bashful Boy
runners.spotlight: Arrives here after three solid efforts in 2m AW handicaps, the latest behind Appier; however, he's not won for a long time and finishing effort can be questionable.

runners.comment: Won a steadily run 1m4f handicap but truer fractions exposed him next time
runners.name: Id Go Maniac
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; won a steadily run 1m4f handicap at Wolverhampton (handicap debut) but couldn't get involved off a truer pace behind Appier back there one month ago; that run perhaps exposed his limitations.

runners.comment: Won twice in 2025 after wind surgery but has seemingly regressed in the meantime
runners.name: Educator
runners.spotlight: Won handicaps at about 1m4f early last year after wind surgery but has seemingly regressed in the meantime; others are more convincing.

runners.comment: Well handicapped back on the Flat and hasn't been running badly over hurdles
runners.name: Knight Templar
runners.spotlight: Well weighed on the hat-trick he completed for this yard during the second half of 2024 and hasn't been running badly over hurdles this winter, including a near miss at Exeter in November; one to consider.

runners.comment: Reverting to positive tactics may help but has yet to look at home on the AW
runners.name: Lusaka
runners.spotlight: Found himself out the back the last twice and his last two wins have been from the front; could easily run well if reverting to those tactics, though has yet to look at home on the AW.

runners.comment: Well beaten in two 1m4f handicaps before another disappointing run back over hurdles
runners.name: Dr Waksman
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden who was well beaten in two 1m4f handicaps before another disappointing run back over hurdles last month; has placed form on AW but a bit to prove now.

18:30.race_name: Unibet Support Safer Gambling Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier) (Div I)

runners.comment: Yet to win a handicap but he has threatened, including C&D; should make a bold bid
runners.name: Gilet
runners.spotlight: Yet to win a handicap but not for a lack of effort and he ran well for second over C&D last month; perhaps stretched by 1m2f at Lingfield last month and he is one to take seriously back down in trip.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 in fine form but this contest demands another personal best from him
runners.name: Towerlands
runners.spotlight: Ended 2025 on the up, winning 1m handicaps at Southwell (twice) and Lingfield before a solid second at Newcastle 23 days ago; another 1lb higher today and he needs to raise his game again.

runners.comment: This looks a deeper race than the one he won at Chelmsford two weeks ago; reliable though
runners.name: High On Hope
runners.spotlight: He had been threatening prior to his narrow win at Chelmsford 13 days ago (1m); this is a more competitive race though and another personal best will be required to win.

runners.comment: C&D winner but not at his best when behind Gilet here last time; others appeal more
runners.name: King Of Fury
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late P R Blackett
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins in the first half of 2025, including C&D; not at his best here seven weeks ago (finished behind Gilet) and others are preferred for win purposes.

runners.comment: Three wins last January before a ten-month absence; latest run threatened better
runners.name: Joolianoss
runners.spotlight: Reeled off a quick hat-trick last January (1m-1m2f); absent for ten months afterwards and finished well beaten on his reappearance; latest Lingfield run was better and he could be building up to something bigger.

runners.comment: Wide-margin 1m2f win (Class 6) in November; well held off this mark twice since
runners.name: Renesmee
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin win in Class 6 company in November (1m2f); less good twice since and needs more to overcome this mark.

runners.comment: Got up late to win a 7f handicap here two weeks ago; stays 1m and respected up 5lb
runners.name: Billy Mill
runners.spotlight: Returned from a 147-day break with a 7f win here two weeks ago, running on strongly to lead close home; fully effective over this extra furlong and he can go well despite the 5lb higher mark.

runners.comment: Drew a blank in 2025; latest C&D run was okay but more is needed to end his barren spell
runners.name: Mostawaa
runners.spotlight: Veteran who drew a blank in 2025; latest midfield finish over C&D needs bettering but he has slipped to a lowly mark.

19:00.race_name: Unibet Support Safer Gambling Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier) (Div II)

runners.breeder: S C E A Le Haras DHaspel
runners.comment: Chance on his Wolverhampton second last month but failed to back it up one week later
runners.name: Shihoku
runners.spotlight: The pick of his four runs for James Owen came when second of 11 at Wolverhampton last month; failed to build on it when favourite back at Wolverhampton (9.5f) one week later; needs a revival but it isn't out of the question.

runners.comment: Last year's two wins were 1m4f and 1m6f; opposable at 1m
runners.name: Trojan Storm
runners.spotlight: Low-key return to action at Wolverhampton on Boxing Day (first run since a 1m6f win in July); drop to 1m unlikely to play to his strengths.

runners.comment: Off the mark upped to 1m at Southwell 24 days ago; still has potential; leading claims
runners.name: Fight Your Corner
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the third attempt when landing a 1m novice at Southwell 24 days ago; could have more to offer now handicapping and he is of obvious interest.

runners.comment: Both wins over C&D, the latest two weeks ago; up 3lb and steps back up into Class 4
runners.name: Port Road
runners.spotlight: Both wins over C&D, the latest two weeks ago off a 3lb lower mark; up in class this time but certainly not handicapped out of things.

runners.comment: Failed to win last year and never dangerous on first run in 2026; lowly mark but risky
runners.name: Signcastle City
runners.spotlight: Won three times in 2024 but drew a blank last year; no real threat over 1m at Southwell 18 days ago but he continues to edge down the weights.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 quietly but Oisin Murphy booked for his return and blinkers are now added
runners.name: Midnights Dream
runners.spotlight: Won two of his first three starts in 2025 but out of sorts here on his final two starts of the campaign; Oisin Murphy replaces a 7lb claimer today and blinkers are now given a go; revival quite possible.

runners.comment: Latest Southwell run (7f) was his best for new connections; return to 1m a plus; contender
runners.name: Panelli
runners.spotlight: His win for George Boughey was achieved over a mile and his three runs for new connections have been 5f, 6f and 7f; latest Southwell run was more promising and he is one to be interested back up in distance.

runners.comment: Third of nine behind Port Road here two weeks ago when 66-1; not sure to build on it
runners.name: I Am Me
runners.spotlight: 66-1 when third of nine behind Port Road here two weeks ago; chance if he can build on that but overall profile suggests that wouldn't be assured.

19:30.race_name: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts Handicap (London Middle Distance Qualifier) (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Good placed efforts on last two runs over this C&D; should run his race once again
runners.name: Londoner
runners.spotlight: Not a prolific winner but he has run well on his last two C&D starts; not at his best tried in blinkers eight weeks ago but usual cheekpieces return and he is one to consider.

runners.comment: Struggled since September and now steps up in trip with a point to prove
runners.name: Mr Baloo
runners.spotlight: In fine form in early 2025 but he has found it hard work since September's return from a three-month break; may need some more help from the handicapper; first run over further than 1m2f.

runners.comment: Yet to add to his debut win but several good runs last year; e-w claims back from a break
runners.name: Son Of Man
runners.spotlight: Has not added to his debut win in 19 races since but he went mighty close on AW last spring and finished second at Nottingham when last seen 12 weeks ago; not discounted.

runners.comment: C&D winner; latest Lingfield 3rd was a step back in the right direction; not ruled out
runners.name: Ludos Landing
runners.spotlight: C&D win in 2024; only six ran when he won at Thirsk last summer but it was off a 1lb higher mark and he looked on the way back to form when third at Lingfield seven weeks ago; not discounted.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 with a good 2nd at Lingfield (1m2f); longer trip a positive; not fully exposed
runners.name: Shrimp Shady
runners.spotlight: Looked promising as a 2yo; disappointed in August/September last year but he returned to form with a good second at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) 30 days ago; hit with a 3lb rise for that but stepping back up in trip will suit and he's not fully exposed.

runners.comment: Yet to run a poor race at this track and she returns to Kempton off a reduced mark; chance
runners.name: Umbria
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who is yet to run a poor race at this track; recent return to action at Southwell should have sharpened her up and a 3lb drop in the weights will help; better expected this time.

runners.comment: Near miss at Lingfield 11 days ago (1m2f); current wellbeing will count for plenty
runners.name: Woodstock City
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m3f Class 5 handicap at Southwell in October and slightly better form when collared late over 1m2f at Lingfield 11 days ago; 1lb higher in a better race but current wellbeing will count for plenty here.

runners.comment: Not fired yet this winter but down in weights and a revival is possible
runners.name: Yokohama
runners.spotlight: Beaten 18 times following his successful racecourse debut but some of last year's placed form reads well and he should be at concert pitch after two runs back from a 109-day layoff; can't discount.

20:00.race_name: Try Unibet's Same Race Multi Handicap

runners.comment: Looks a likely improver now stepping up to middle distances for his handicap debut
runners.name: Von Dutch
runners.spotlight: Fetched 325,000gns as a yearling; modest form in three runs this winter (7f and 8.6f) but there has been a whiff of promise and stepping up in trip looks sure to suit; can do better.

runners.comment: Disappointing at two but gelded since latest run and middle distances should suit better
runners.name: Maxwellcan
runners.spotlight: Bred to be better than he showed in his four runs as a 2yo, including when sent off the 11-8 favourite for his nursery debut at Newcastle in November (1m); gelded since and this step up to middle distances could see him take a step forward.

runners.comment: 1m2f winner last season; solid efforts in defeat since; new trip/headgear can help
runners.name: Onyeisi
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m2f nursery at Chelmsford in November (blinkered first time), after which he was gelded; three solid efforts have followed and the step up in trip and change of headgear could squeeze out a bit more.

runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Off mark when quickening best in slowly-run 1m2f race at Newcastle; stamina query at 1m4f
runners.name: Trust No One
runners.spotlight: 0-5 for Alice Haynes; off the mark on second run for new stable when the well-backed winner of a 1m2f handicap at Newcastle 12 days ago, picking up well to beat Onyeisi in a slowly-run race; 3lb rise not excessive but his stamina for this trip has to be taken on trust.

runners.comment: Steps up in trip for h'cap debut and may improve but her sire has a poor record over 1m2f+
runners.name: Cospicua
runners.spotlight: Big prices and modest form in three fillies' novice events over 7f and 1m; stamina on the dam's side of her pedigree but she would be a rare winner for her sire Swiss Spirit over this sort of trip (just 3-121 over 1m2f+).

runners.comment: Modest form at around 1m but upped in trip for handicap debut and can do much better
runners.name: Jerseygeordie
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three novice runs (1m-8.5f); his brother Jerriais made a winning handicap debut after a slow start to his career too so there are grounds for expecting much better upped to middle distances.

12:35.race_name: BetMGM Supports Safer Gambling Amateur Jockeys' Handicap

runners.comment: Settled better than usual when scoring at Kempton a week ago; a player under 5lb pen
runners.name: Vizzavona Lady
runners.spotlight: Settled better than usual under today's rider when resuming winning ways in 7f Kempton handicap a week ago; she's a player under a 5lb penalty.

runners.comment: Remains winless and a below-par fourth in 7f Leicester claimer in October; more is needed
runners.name: Joycean Way
runners.owner: J Harley T Jacobs G Moore
runners.spotlight: Reliable sort who turned in a rare below-par effort when fourth of five in 7f Leicester claimer in October; handily weighted if back on song after a break for his in-form yard.

runners.comment: Step back in right direction with Wolver fourth 19 days ago; needs considering
runners.name: Ciotog
runners.spotlight: On a losing run but he took a step back in the right direction when fourth of ten in 9.5f Wolverhampton handicap 19 days ago; needs considering off a 2lb lower mark.

runners.comment: C&D winner; solid third for current yard at Kempton week ago; in the mix off same mark
runners.name: Rising Force
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in August on his final run for Robert Eddery and he posted a solid third of six to Vizzavona Lady for his current yard in 7f Kempton handicap a week ago; in the mix off an unchanged mark.

runners.comment: Good second for new yard at Kempton week ago; must enter calculations off unchanged mark
runners.name: Knightmare
runners.spotlight: Took a step forward for his new yard (formerly with Dylan Cunha) when second of six to Vizzavona Lady in 7f Kempton handicap a week ago; he must enter calculations off the same mark in his bid for a maiden victory.

runners.breeder: Mrs S Bunney & Mr P Taplin
runners.comment: Yet to register a victory but she arrives in good nick; one for the shortlist eased 1lb
runners.name: Whiteley Way
runners.spotlight: Yet to register a victory but she arrives in good nick, fourth of 12 in 9.5f Wolverhampton handicap last month; one for the shortlist eased 1lb.

runners.comment: C&D scorer but he's an unreliable sort; headgear again left off and others are preferred
runners.name: Semser
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer but he's an unreliable sort and beat just two back over C&D 35 days ago; usual headgear is again left off here and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Beat only one in 1m Southwell handicap four days ago; cheekpieces are reached for now
runners.name: Summer Evening
runners.spotlight: Yet to make the frame in her seven starts and she beat only one in 1m Southwell handicap four days ago; cheekpieces are reached for now.

13:05.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 20,000gns yearling; lacks experience and partnered by a 7lb claimer; best watched
runners.name: Portman Blue
runners.spotlight: 20,000gns yearling; half-brother to 5f winner Jamie's Choice (RPR 61) and a winner abroad by Footstepsinthesand; dam 1m winner; lacks experience and partnered by a 7lb claimer; best watched.

runners.comment: 200-1 and beaten 24l in a 1m maiden here two weeks ago; no appeal for now
runners.name: Harry Dont Bite
runners.spotlight: 200-1 and beaten 24l in a 1m maiden here two weeks ago; no appeal for now.

runners.comment: Got up in the nick of time over 6f at Chelmsford; penalised but sent further now
runners.name: Evenepoel
runners.spotlight: Showed promise over 5f and did well to win over the extra furlong at Chelmsford given he was slowly away and seemingly outpaced; finished well and now upped to 7f under a penalty; should feature.

runners.comment: Clear at one stage before headed late on by the favourite here last time (1m)
runners.name: Foothold
runners.spotlight: Bang there in his last two races, over Bath's extended 5f and then outstayed by the winner when headed late on over 1m here; the winner was odds-on and he was clear of the rest, so that was a good run; 7f might be a better fit given running style.

runners.comment: Well placed in a modestly-run race when just missing out at Wolverhampton
runners.name: High Chieftain
runners.spotlight: Ridden more positively when going down narrowly over 7f at Wolverhampton in December (backed at 100-30); he was well placed in a modestly-run race but clearly has ability.

runners.comment: Did show a bit more upped to this trip here 21 days ago but still only seventh of ten
runners.name: Savvi Row
runners.spotlight: Did show a bit more upped to this trip here 21 days ago but still only seventh of ten and posted a modest RPR.

runners.comment: Closely matched with Evenepoel; seems speedy and goes an extra furlong here
runners.name: Allegrino
runners.spotlight: Always in rear on debut but ridden up with the pace the last twice and just missed out at Kempton and Chelmsford (again over 6f); better off at the weights with latest winner Evenepoel but this filly has further to go this afternoon.

runners.comment: Always in rear in finished last over 6f here three weeks ago, at 50-1
runners.name: Anaba Girl
runners.spotlight: Always in rear in finished last over 6f here three weeks ago; at 50-1, not a lot was seemingly expected.

runners.comment: 100-1 when eighth of the ten runners over 1m at Yarmouth three months ago
runners.name: Hurricane Ann
runners.spotlight: 100-1 when eighth of the ten runners over 1m at Yarmouth three months ago (in rear throughout); needed to show more.

13:35.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.comment: Cheekpieces back on when scoring at Chelmsford latest; player with the headgear retained
runners.name: Marinakis
runners.spotlight: Resumed winning ways (with cheekpieces back on) in 1m2f classified event at Chelmsford ten days ago; yard is going great guns so he's a player with the headgear retained here.

runners.comment: C&D scorer who nearly went in again at Wolverhampton on Monday evening
runners.name: Al Shabab
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer who nearly went in again at Wolverhampton on Monday evening (9.4f); respected if turned out again.

runners.comment: Scored at Bath (13f) in September but she's been below par of late
runners.name: Endofastorm

runners.comment: Won 2m h'cap on last year's card; also won (2m1f) in December; this trip worth another go
runners.name: Bathgate
runners.spotlight: Won the 2m handicap hurdle on this card last year; followed two near misses with a pretty convincing win at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft) in December and shaped like this trip is worth another go when fourth at Musselburgh one month ago, respected.

runners.comment: Just failed to get back up under Murray Dodd (2m3f, good) latest; bold bid on the cards
runners.name: Inferno Sacree
runners.spotlight: Likeable gelding who can normally be relied on to give it a good go, as he did when narrowly failing to get back up under Murray Dodd at Taunton (2m3f, good) three weeks ago; won't be easy to dominate this big field but he still commands plenty of respect.

runners.comment: Quiet stable debut when beaten 25l over C&D (good) last month; tongue-tie goes on
runners.name: Gardener
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner for Olly Murphy, once over hurdles, but it was a quiet stable debut when beaten 25l over C&D (good) towards the end of last month; maybe the added tongue-tie will help but not easy to suggest after that.

runners.comment: Good stable debut when close third in November; bit below that latest but still considered
runners.name: As Fast As Wind
runners.spotlight: Won at Kempton (2m, good) for Daisy Hitchins in October and was picked up for £12,000 out of a Huntingdon claimer the following month; good stable debut when a close third at Sedgefield (2m4f, soft) three weeks later and she ran a bit better than the beaten margin at Market Rasen last time;  hood (has run well in one before) reappears alongside an added tongue-tie and she's considered.

runners.comment: Made the breakthrough at Doncaster six weeks ago; unexposed sort and a big player up 7lb
runners.name: Kelijoe
runners.spotlight: Favourite or joint-favourite for all three handicaps and he made the breakthrough at Doncaster (about 2m4f, good to soft) six weeks ago; did it comfortably that day and this unexposed sort looks a big player up 7lb.

runners.comment: Promise in 2nd qualifying run; had wind surgery & could improve now h'capping over further
runners.name: Hey Buddy
runners.spotlight: All three qualifying runs came at 2m on good ground and there was promise in the second of them, when third of nine at Hereford in November; had wind surgery since his last start and could show improvement now handicapping over further.

runners.comment: Won twice off higher marks last spring; heavy ground a plausible excuse last time
runners.name: Thank You Blue
runners.spotlight: Won twice off higher marks last spring; no wins since but he came home well when fourth of 12 at Wetherby (about 2m5f, good) in October and heavy ground was a plausible excuse the following month.

runners.comment: 8-time winner here (Flat and jumps); respectable over further of late; can't rule out
runners.name: Bollin Neil
runners.spotlight: Eight-time winner here (Flat and jumps) who has been running respectably over further at this venue since November; drop back in trip asks a question but he's impossible to rule out.

runners.comment: 2-4 in headgear since October; 2nd of 14 in first-time blinkers latest; leading contender
runners.name: Jack Hoola
runners.spotlight: In-form hurdler who is 2-4 in headgear since October, wins over about this trip at Huntingdon and Southwell (visored) followed by a keeping-on second of 14 in first-time blinkers at Exeter (about 2m2f, soft) last month; 1lb nudge won't stop him being a leading contender.

runners.comment: Poor in 2 h'caps (chase/hurdle); still early days in this sphere but he needs to show more
runners.name: Sams Falcon
runners.spotlight: Didn't take to fences when making his handicap debut last month and was beaten over 30l back over hurdles three weeks later; still early days in this sphere but he needs to show more.

runners.comment: Won over C&D in November but unpredictable and well beaten over C&D last month
runners.name: I See The Sea
runners.spotlight: Won at Wincanton (3m1f, good to soft) last March and back on the scoresheet over this C&D (good) in November; not ruled out but he's unpredictable and was well beaten over C&D (good) last month.

runners.comment: Won by nearly 10l at Wetherby on second chase start when sporting first-time headgear
runners.name: Wolfburg
runners.spotlight: Won maiden hurdle here (1m7f, soft) in February 2024 and, following a spell in the doldrums, he returned to form to win by nearly 10l in first-time tongue-tie/cheekpieces at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) on Boxing Day on his second chase start; new trip today but there's some stamina in his pedigree and he could take a 6lb rise in his stride if the headgear maintains its effect.

runners.comment: Returns from long absence but he's on a handy mark on his best efforts; betting may guide
runners.name: Getaway Glory
runners.spotlight: Some solid chase form in 2024; returns from a long absence but he's on a handy mark on his best efforts; the betting may be informative.

runners.comment: Went close at Market Rasen where well clear of the third; a first win could be imminent
runners.name: Alltalknoaction
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but held every chance when falling two out at Market Rasen (3m, good to soft) in December on second chase start and he's gone close there since (3m, good to soft) with these cheekpieces applied, when a long way clear of the third; ran well on soft in a point; a first win could be imminent.

runners.comment: Second of four here last time and the step back up in trip may well be a plus
runners.name: Defence Witness
runners.spotlight: Won at Cartmel (2m5f, good to soft) last May and returned to form when second of four here (2m3f, good) on New Year's Day; the step back up in trip may well be a plus and he might not be far away.

runners.comment: 12yo whose form can be up and down but he's won on his last two visits to Catterick
runners.name: Valence dAumont
runners.spotlight: 12yo whose form can be up and down but he's won on his last two visits to Catterick (soft/good), the latest over C&D last month when beating Mersey Street by a short head; he's a player if backing up that effort.

runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but lightly raced over fences and beaten a short head over C&D last month
runners.name: Mersey Street
runners.spotlight: Just 1-20 under rules but lightly raced over fences and he was short-headed by Valence d'Aumont in a big field over C&D last month (good; led); chiefly kept to good ground but has shown some promise on soft/good to soft; there's every chance he'll be bang there once more.

runners.comment: Returned from a long absence towards the end of last year and has struggled
runners.name: Ballylinch
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on his good form in spring 2024; however, he returned from a long absence towards the end of last year and has struggled.

runners.comment: Tailed off/pulled up last month in his first two chases
runners.name: Kuriosa
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles in Ireland in 2023-24 and, after an unsuccessful stint in points, he was tailed off/pulled up last month in his first two chases.

runners.comment: Stamina to prove but this step up in trip is worth a go judged on his latest effort here
runners.name: Bravethewaves
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent sort whose three chase wins (including here) have come over 2m3f/2m4f; however, he was outpaced when a 14l fourth of seven over 2m3f here last month and this step up in trip is worth a go; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Hint of promise at Ayr this month from a long way out of the handicap; not discounted
runners.name: Whispering Dancer
runners.spotlight: One from six in points (won over 3m on heavy) and very lightly raced under rules; from a long way out of the handicap he showed some promise when 15l fifth of 14 at Ayr (3m, soft) this month on his second chase start and he runs off an 8lb lower mark this afternoon; not discounted.

runners.comment: Sole win (from 24 attempts) came in May 2023; not shaping as though a win is imminent
runners.name: Derracrin
runners.spotlight: Won at Hexham in May 2023 and he's 4lb lower today; however, that remains his sole success (from 24 attempts) and he hasn't shaped of late as though he's about to return to winning ways.

runners.comment: 33-1 second over C&D in November but two lesser performances have followed from this 11yo
runners.name: Sputnik
runners.spotlight: 33-1 runner-up to I See The Sea over C&D in November; however, two lesser performances have followed and this 11yo needs to get back on track.

runners.comment: Pulled up/tailed off on all six chase starts and he would be a shock winner
runners.name: Stonegate
runners.spotlight: Pulled up/tailed off on all six chase starts and he would be a shock winner from 10lb out of the handicap.

15:20.race_name: Download Raceday Ready Today Handicap Hurdle (Go North Sea Pigeon Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but sole win came last month on second start for this stable; thereabouts
runners.name: Newport
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his 24 attempts but that came at Musselburgh (1m7f, soft) last month on his second start for this stable; again ran well when third at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) 11 days later and he could be thereabouts.

runners.comment: Did it readily at Windsor on New Year's Day; still mileage in mark judged on Flat ability
runners.name: Rukaana
runners.spotlight: Improved upon previous hurdle form to get off the mark at the 11th attempt in this code at Windsor (2m, good) on New Year's Day; did it readily and there remains mileage in his mark (now 9lb higher) judged on his Flat ability; has shown hints of promise on soft/good to soft ground.

runners.comment: Pulled up on handicap debut but after some time off and he'd shown some ability previously
runners.name: Mexican Stan
runners.spotlight: Pulled up at 22-1 on handicap debut at Huntingdon (2m3f, good to soft) in November; however, that was his first run since last March and he showed signs of ability in novice hurdle; wears a first-time tongue-tie and this lightly raced 6yo is one to watch in the betting.

runners.comment: Merely fifth in the autumn on last two hurdle starts and he's 0-26 overall
runners.name: Vampire Slayer
runners.spotlight: Twice finished runner-up on the Flat last year but merely fifth in the autumn on his last two hurdle starts and he's now 0-26 overall following a below-par run on AW last month; a first-time visor replaces cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Inconsistent this term and losing run continues but not ruled out off dangerous mark
runners.name: Scots Poet
runners.spotlight: 10yo whose losing sequence goes back 17 races to April 2024 and he's been inconsistent over fences this season; however, he hasn't been devoid of spark and this four-time hurdle winner has dropped to a dangerous mark; not ruled out now back hurdling in first-time blinkers.

runners.comment: Ran okay when fifth on handicap debut; this lightly raced 5yo could take a step forward
runners.name: Romancier
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 7l by the winner Newport when fifth of ten at 9-1 on last month's handicap debut at Musselburgh (1m7f, soft); improvement is needed but he's raced only five times and could take a step forward at some point.

runners.comment: Goes handicapping off a lowly mark and was progressive on the Flat last year; check market
runners.name: Queen Roslyn
runners.spotlight: Made hurdle debut in November and soundly beaten on her three runs in this code, but she now goes handicapping off a lowly mark and she was progressive on the Flat last year (albeit at modest level); this 5yo will be all the more interesting if attracting market support.

runners.comment: Runner-up in bumper/maiden hurdle in 2024 but has struggled in handicaps
runners.name: Wednesday Addams
runners.spotlight: Point winner who was runner-up in a bumper and a maiden hurdle in 2024; however, she's struggled to get competitive since switching to handicaps and is now 0-12 under rules.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Sedgefield in May 2024; absent since but well treated if retaining ability
runners.name: Sattam
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo who was runner-up at Sedgefield in May 2024 on his second handicap start; absent since but he's well handicapped if retaining his old ability; he's one to watch in the betting.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
runners.comment: Of interest on his good form in October but well beaten on his last two starts
runners.name: Platenium
runners.spotlight: Won at Uttoxeter in October and good third at Newcastle later that month; however, he's been well beaten on his last two starts and needs to turn things around now in blinkers; cheekpieces were given a go last time.

runners.comment: 4yo who is 1-10 over hurdles, the win a fortunate one; soundly beaten in sole handicap
runners.name: Genbu
runners.spotlight: 4yo who is 1-10 over hurdles, the win a fortunate one at Wetherby in October (left in the lead at the final flight); soundly beaten on handicap hurdle debut at Wetherby on Boxing Day and needs something extra here.

runners.comment: Two-time Flat winner but has struggled under both codes from last July onwards
runners.name: Susiesparkle
runners.spotlight: Two-time Flat winner, the latest last February (1m2f, AW); however, she struggled under both codes from July onwards and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 5yo who might have an each-way chance now back down in trip
runners.name: Jacksons Bay
runners.spotlight: 0-7 and down the field at Taunton in November last time, but looked stretched by 2m3f; prior to that he ran okay when third of six at Newton Abbot (2m1f, good to soft); might have each-way chance now back down in trip.

runners.comment: 4 Flat wins here; didn't appear to see out 2m3f here last time; could be in the shake-up
runners.name: Stellarmasterpiece
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner here on the Flat; lightly raced over hurdles and didn't appear to see out the extended 2m3f here last month; could be in the shake-up now back down in distance.

runners.comment: Some reasonable efforts last year but this longstanding maiden needs something extra
runners.name: Mr Globalist
runners.spotlight: Ran the occasional reasonable race last year but this longstanding maiden needs to improve on those efforts if he's to get off the mark today.

15:50.race_name: Racing Again 30th January 'Junior' National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)

runners.comment: By Circus Maximus; yard 2-29 in bumpers over the last five seasons; market may help
runners.name: Bound For Glory
runners.spotlight: By Circus Maximus; second foal; dam 7f-1m2f AW Flat (RPR 70)/2m hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Frederick William (2m), Ventura Castle (9.7f/1m2f), At First Light (bumper and 2m-2m6f hurdles) and Design Icon (2m4f hurdle); yard is 2-29 in bumpers over the last five seasons; market may help.

runners.comment: By Nathaniel; related to connections' high-class Paint The Dream; considered on debut
runners.name: Broadway Dreamer
runners.spotlight: By Nathaniel; fourth foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Paint The Dream (high-class 2m3f-2m6f hurdle/chase) and Gats And Co (2m7f-3m6f chase), out of French 2m hurdle winner; yard has a solid strike-rate in bumpers; market helpful.

runners.comment: Sets the standard on debut 6th but it's not an overly daunting one; may still improve
runners.name: Campfield Flyer
runners.spotlight: Weakened to finish 20l behind on his debut at Aintree (good to soft; 12-1) in November; could improve, and that run still sets the standard, but it's not an overly daunting one.

runners.comment: Green but plodded on to be beaten 22l on his debut one month ago; may do better
runners.name: Cribbins
runners.spotlight: Green but plodded on to be beaten 22l on his debut at Hereford (soft; 16-1) one month ago; needs a step forward but that's not out of the question.

runners.comment: 11,000euros yearling; yard in fine form & had good bumper winner last week; considered
runners.name: Nightflyer
runners.spotlight: 11,000euros yearling by Amaron; third foal; brother to Italian 1m2f Flat and 1m7f/2m1f jumps winner Night Of Dreams; dam German maiden, sister to German 1m2f winner Night Time, half-sister to German 7f-1m7f winner Night Ocean, out of German 1m1f winner; yard in fine form and is 1-1 in bumpers (a wide-margin winner at Ayr last Tuesday) this term; betting a good guide.

runners.comment: By Telescope; yard has occasional winners in this sphere; hooded and tongue tied for debut
runners.name: Teddie
runners.spotlight: By Telescope; sixth foal; half-brother to 2m7f/3m hurdle winner Thank You Ma'am; dam smart 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase winner, half-sister to winners Velocity Boy (useful 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase) and Fortunes Hiding (bumper/2m4f-3m1f chase); yard has occasional winners in this sphere; hooded and tongue tied for debut.

runners.breeder: S N C Ecurie Drost & S N C Ecurie Tyga
runners.comment: 50,000euros yearling by Masked Marvel; stable takes bumpers seriously; player on debut
runners.name: Luna Lux
runners.spotlight: 50,000euros yearling by Masked Marvel; second foal; half-sister to 2m4f hurdle winner Sept Etoiles; dam French 2m1f-2m6f hurdle/chase winner, closely related to useful French 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner Jazz In Montreux, out of Listed-placed French 7.5f-1m5f winner; stable takes bumpers seriously and this debutante looks a likely contender.

runners.comment: By classy Italian jumper Frammassone; yard is 5-52 in bumpers; betting could be helpful
runners.name: Mischief Millie
runners.spotlight: By classy Italian jumper Frammassone; fifth foal; half-sister to bumper and smart 2m4f-2m7f hurdle/chase winner High Class Hero; dam French 2m1f hurdle winner, half-sister to useful 2m5f-3m hurdle/chase winner Baden; yard is 5-52 in bumpers; betting could be helpful.

runners.comment: Flat-bred filly who stepped up a little last time but was still beaten a long way again
runners.name: The Lakes
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred filly who stepped up a little when sixth of ten at Doncaster (soft) in November; was still beaten a long way and needs a fair bit more, though.
